ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned elementary Turkish language/grammar and culture.
A great foundation of the turkish language which will help me in the future for what I aspire to do.

I learnt the fundamentals of the Turkish language. We learnt suffixes, compound nouns, possessive, person, and present/future/"to do" markers (similar to Spanish conjugation). Learning was centered around situations such as going to school, buying something from a market, showing your apartment/bedroom.
I developed foundational skills in Turkish speaking, listening, reading, writing and culture. I also gained deeper understanding of different language structures and how they relate to English.
Learned introductory Turkish. In other words, foundational grammar and necessary vocab for a variety of everyday topics.
I learned a fair amount of Turkish that lets me hold a conversation.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: No weaknesses! Only strengths. I love the class. The setup of the course was like a flipped classroom, where we practice more with speaking and listening in class and do grammar at home. This was very helpful. We also learned a lot about Turkish culture with the cultural events. The best language course I have taken at Yale
Nothing it was perfectly structured and changes were made to accommodate the students. Cannot ask for more as a student.

Strengths: During class we practiced reading listening and writing skills. Class was fast paced but she was willing to slow down to write or spell a unfamiliar word. End of week asynchronous quiz was extremely useful in testing our knowledge. Asynchronous decreased the stress factor and let us focus on studying. Loved the cultural showcases we had after every exam. We also had access to a tutor who we could meet up with to get extra help.

Weaknesses: More structured grammar practice could be useful. Much was provided but a little more would be nice

This course is strong because it encourages several different forms of engagement with the language, from cultural activities to methodical grammar lessons. One way it might be improved is if there was a compiled resource for the grammar rules with examples that students could refer to.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student to fulfill their language requirement and learn about an amazing culture.
Absolutely, wonderful course I wish I could continue on but will do so on my own.
Yes if you want to learn Turkish. If you are willing to put in the work, you can do well in the class.
I would recommend this course to another student because Instructor Yalcin is very invested in student learning and is very attentive to student needs.

Yes I would definitely recommend. It is fun to start a new language, it is really well taught, and the workload is manageable. Ezgi's passion about teaching and sharing Turkish language and culture really shines through. You also look up and realize that you have learned a lot!
